result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A. Granger Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard A. Granger Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard A. Granger Jr. was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:34 pm Defendant Richard A. Granger in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Richard A. Granger in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes that Motion to Reinstitute on Count 1. Burns states defendant missed court apperance - was in custody in Outagamie Jail. Burns states defendant does not object to motion to reinstitute; would like to proceed to sentencing today. Court grants motion to reinstitute and finds defendant guilty of Count 1. Schiek states has not notified victim of possible sentencing today. Court finds State is compliant with victim rights legislation due to past contacts with victim. Schiek/Burns/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 3 years
Costs are remitted
DNA Sample
The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
No intoxicants; no taverns
No controlled substances or prescription medicines unless valid prescription from physician and then only in dosage/manner as prescribed.
Jail credit - 7 days
AODA treatment or mental health treatment as determined by PO
Remain current on child support
Any other counseling/conditions deemed appropriate by PO

Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 2:55 p.m.

1:29 p.m. Defendant Richard A. Granger in court, in custody via video.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court recites record. Court quashes warrant. Defendant states he was in Appleton and mother was in hospital - she is his means of transportion. Was told that warrant was quashed and case was dismissed. Schiek statement to bond. Defendant states he has 2 full time jobs. Court sets bond. Defendant requests signature bond. Court denies. Adj. 1:35 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Per Rachel - in ONSO _ - Per DA's office - will appear 3-1

5:08 Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Burns statement- has not had any contact with him - all numbers she had were disconnected - Pfeifer statement - may be in OUtagamie County Jail - Court finds basis to rescind - but will hold under advisement and authorize warrant for appearance -

3:30 pm Defendant Richard A. Granger not in court.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sowinski states motion to rescind will be filed. Motion hearing date to be obtained from Branch 2 JA. Bail continued. Adj. 3:31 p.m.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DEJ filed

1:55 p.m. Defendant Richard A. Granger in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. State moves to dismiss Counts 2, 3 and 4 - Granted. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 1. DEJ to be filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and accepts deferred judgment agreement. Bail continued. Adj. 2:03 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for November 29, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Richard A. Granger in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns. Defendant in custody from Lincoln County  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:44
In receipt of information - waive reading - not guilty plea entered
Schiek statement - resolution but awaiting outcome of Lincoln County Case
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

3:47 p.m. Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Burns states defendant is in Lincoln County jail. Michlig states Writ was not prepared. Adj. 3:48 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

04:17 pm - Defendant Richard A. Granger in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Richard A. Granger in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - Defendant would like to waive preliminary.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Burns requests Arriagnment/Pretrial Conference.  Bail continued  Arraignment scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Adjourned initial appearance at 07-01-2015 04:00 pm

03:45 pm - Defendant Richard A. Granger not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states PD office contacted BR II - Defendant was found eligible for appointment of counsel - however, PD's office has not been able to appoint PD as of today's date.  State requests and Court authorizes warrant.
